text.icl.notification: Items on the ground will be removed in %d seconds
text.icl.readme:
§l§nCommands§r

The main command provided by ICL is §a/icl§r, which has several subcommands:

- §a/icl forceclean§r: Immediately clears all items on the ground.
- §a/icl reload§r: Reloads the ICL.
- §a/icl config set <key> <value>§r: Changes a configuration value. To see current configuration value, use /icl config set <key>.
- §a/icl cancel [seconds]§r: Cancels the next clear. If a number of seconds is provided, the next clear will be scheduled after that many seconds.

§l§nConfiguration§r

Configuration values can be changed using the §a/icl config set§r command. Here are some of the configurable values:

- §aDelay§r: The delay (in seconds) between automatic item clears.
- §aNotificationDelay§r: The delay (in seconds) before a clear when a notification will be sent.
- §aNotificationStart§r: The time (in seconds) when notifications start being sent before a clear.
- §aNotificationTimes§r: The number of notifications to send before a clear.
- §aCountdownStart§r: The time (in seconds) when the countdown starts before a clear.
- §adoNotificationCountdown§r: Whether to show a countdown before a clear.
- §adoNotificationSound§r: Whether to play a sound when a notification is sent.
- §adoLastNotificationSound§r: Whether to play a sound when a last notification is sent.
- §aNotificationSound§r: The sound to play when a notification is sent.
- §aLastNotificationSound§r: The sound to play when a last notification is sent.
- §aNotificationLang§r: The language for notifications.
- §aNotificationColor§r: The color for notifications.
- §aRequireOp§r: Whether to require OP to use ICL commands(except /icl, /icl cancel).
- §aRequireOpCancel§r: Whether to require OP to cancel a clear.
- §apreserveNoDespawnItems§r: Whether to preserve items that are set to never despawn.
- §apreserveNoPickupItems§r: Whether to preserve items that are set to never be picked up.
